alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 14 at 1:46PM MST until February 15 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY FOR AREAS ALONG AND EAST OF I-25 AND ALONG AND SOUTH OF I-40 DUE TO STRONG WINDS...LOW HUMIDITY...ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS... .Above normal temperatures will combine with strong southwest winds, very low humidity, and unstable conditions on Tuesday to generate critical fire weather conditions mainly along and south of I-40 and along and east of I-25 below any significant snowpack. Strong southwest winds will continue through Tuesday night into Wednesday across parts of the southern high terrain and eastern plains. A Fire Weather Watch is in effect Wednesday for the East Central Plains mainly east of the Pecos Valley. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 6 PM MST Tuesday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...East Central Plains from late Tuesday morning through late Tuesday afternoon as well as late Wednesday morning through late Wednesday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20-30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph Tuesday afternoon and southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to around 50 mph Wednesday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 6 to 10 percent Tuesday afternoon and 10 to 15 percent Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
